newsitem.title: USA: U.S. seeks best bids Wednesday for next SPR sale.
newsitem.headline: U.S. seeks best bids Wednesday for next SPR sale.

text.p: The U.S. government asked for best and final offers Wednesday at 1300 EST/1800 GMT in the fourth round of its ongoing oil sale from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, an Energy Department official said.
If there are any awards, they will be announced later in the day, the official said.
Initial bids in the latest round were due Tuesday. The Defense Fuel Supply Center, which is running the auction, typically awards the sales three days after initial bids.
The government is in the process of selling SPR oil to help trim the federal budget gap by $220 million. So far it has raised $88.5 million.
